page.title: 17Copcourt Manor
page.content: Copcourt Manor forms a small part of the Copcourt Estate. The house used to be a monastery and has a moat all around it. The moat is 3 to 4 metres wide and is quite deep. There are four bridges over the moat, one to each side of the house. Most of the buildings are old, some are green from water rising. The windows are old fashioned and at the front of the house apricot trees grow to the first storey. Across the moat are the stables and a beam in the stables has 1756 carved on it. They have eight eventing horses. Three of them are Apollo, Jack and Henry Horse. Jack is over seventeen hands high which is very high for a horse. There is a tennis court which is often used. Copcourt Manor is a private residence.
